node.title: Will Smith on forgiving his father, thoughts of suicide, and "King Richard"
node.description: Preview: In a revealing, emotional interview for "CBS Sunday Morning," the Academy Award-nominee talks with Gayle King about his childhood, and the shocking realization that came with the passing of his father.
node.content: ["Academy Award-nominee Will Smith talks with CBS News' Gayle King about his childhood, thoughts of suicide, forgiving his father, his film \"King Richard,\" and more in a revealing, emotional interview \u00a0for\u00a0\"CBS Sunday Morning,\"\u00a0to be broadcast March 13 on CBS and streamed on Paramount+.", "Smith, 53, is a global superstar who sells millions of albums and toplines blockbuster films. In his book, \"Will,\" Smith tells his life story, warts and all, including the impact on him of seeing his father beat his mother, when he was just 9 years old.", "\"And I didn't do anything,\" Smith said.", "\"But as a little boy, Will, what are you supposed to do?\" King asked.", "\"The child mind doesn't work like that,\" he replied. \"I expected to be a superhero.\"", "Click on the video player to watch a preview clip:\u00a0", "\"My suffering helped me to become who I am.\"", "Global superstar Will Smith, nominated for an Oscar for his performance in \"King Richard,\" sits down with \"@CBSMornings\" co-host @GayleKing to talk about his inspiring life's journey \u2013 from suffering to success pic.twitter.com/OKhvuyB9dq", "Smith told King, co-host of \"CBS Mornings,\" that when his parents separated, he considered taking his own life.", "\"That was the, the only time in my life that I considered suicide,\" he said. \"And, you know \u2026 it just was, it was my fault. You know, I don't know how kids do that \u2026 in their mind, but you know, it was, it was somehow my fault.\"", "Smith said he made peace with his father when his dad was dying in 2016. \"And you know, in that, in those last moments with my father \u2013 when I was able to forgive my father \u2013 I had a shocking realization that I was able to forgive myself \u2026 my father dying started a new phase of my life,\" Smith said.", "In a wide-ranging interview, Smith also talked with King about his work on \"The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air\"; his Oscar-nominated film, \"King Richard\"; his marriage to Jada Pinkett Smith; and what he'd like to do next.", "The Emmy Award-winning \"Sunday Morning\" is broadcast on CBS Sundays beginning at 9 a.m. ET. \"Sunday Morning\" also\u00a0streams on the CBS News app\u00a0[beginning at 10:30 a.m. ET] and on\u00a0Paramount+, and is available on\u00a0cbs.com\u00a0and\u00a0cbsnews.com.", "Be sure to follow us at\u00a0cbssundaymorning.com, and on\u00a0Twitter,\u00a0Facebook,\u00a0Instagram,\u00a0YouTube\u00a0and\u00a0TikTok.", "\u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0For more info:"]
